head.supplied: 2/7/65. ¶ ¶ The Thylacine, dear Mr Gunn, continue in good health. I shall not be able to despatch them until warmer weather sets in. The two wanting volumes of my work I will procure and send to you....

div.p: A251 Gunn papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Transcribed 11.5.93. To proof.
MS inscription probably by Gunn: 'Recd 17/7/ 65 .' 2/7/65.

The Thylacine, dear Mr Gunn, continue in good health. I shall not be able to despatch them until warmer weather sets in. The two wanting volumes of my work I will procure and send to you. As Aide de Camp of the Ladies, who are sending out the expedition in search of poor Leichhardt
Ladies' Leichhardt Search Committee, dates.
I have had to devote much of my spare time to their requirements & hence not progressed so much as it otherwise would have been the case in my literary work. I am however preparing the diagnoses of a number of remarkable plants from N. E. Australia for the 5. vol. of my fragmenta & have sent Bentham all my collections with notes, as far as they are required for the 3 vol of the Universal Austral Flora.

yesterday I described a new Borya
Presumably B. septentrionalis (B65.06.02, p. 41). from N. E Austr, whereas before we knew the genus only from the opposite extreme of the continent. Dawsonia superba is not unfrequent in some of the fern tree gullies of Gipps Land & I have sent several hundred good fruit specimens home, some more than 2' long! It is the largest known moss of the globe[.] I will carefully examine the Telopea moss & let you know its name

Camp[...] I place in Hypoxideae. It is as yet not known out of Tasmania. I have not been able to raise it from seed. Could I get the living plant? No copies of the Flor. Austr are purchasable in Melbourne, the book sellers, strange to say, never ordering any copies. — I think the best way would be to order it directly from Mr Keene.

This work makes material changes to the knowledge of the Tasmanian plants. I have never yet been able to see your Oenothera. It must be very interesting. I have neither had an opportunity of examining the embryo of [Areode...] of Acradenia & seed of Gullenaria diffusa

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I will send you the Roses and other plants.
